title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, colour, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behaviour contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behaviour include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others‚Äô private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible via GitHub platform. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behaviour deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behaviour inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behaviour. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behaviour. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla‚Äôs code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to deweather
text: want make bigger change, ‚Äôs good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ‚Äôs needed. ‚Äôve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex.

title: Contributing to deweather
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven‚Äôt done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("openair-project/deweather", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn‚Äôt pass cleanly, ‚Äôs good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e.¬†just first header).

title: Meteorological Normalisation with {deweather}
text: Meteorology plays central role affecting concentrations pollutants atmosphere. considering trends air pollutants can difficult know whether change concentration due emissions meteorology. default, deweather package uses powerful statistical technique based boosted regression trees using variety packages using tidymodels framework. allows variety engines employed, default xgboost. Statistical models developed explain concentrations using meteorological variables. models can tested randomly withheld data aim developing appropriate model. Much deweather supports parallel processing mirai package, along loading library ‚Äôll set daemons well seed.

title: Meteorological Normalisation with {deweather}
text: deweather package comes comprehensive data set air quality meteorological data. air quality data Marylebone Road central London (obtained openair package) meteorological data Heathrow Airport (obtained worldmet package). aqroadside data frame contains various pollutants NOx, NO2, ethane isoprene well meteorological data including wind speed, wind direction, relative humidity, ambient temperature cloud cover.

title: Meteorological Normalisation with {deweather}
text: straightforward way get started use append_dw_vars() function attach load useful model features air quality data.frame. Variables hour day ("hour") day week ("weekday") used features explain variation. "hour" example usefully acts proxy diurnal variation emissions. temporal emission proxies also important include help model differentiate emission versus weather-related changes. example, emissions tend change throughout day variables wind speed ambient temperature (already present data "ws" "air_temp" respectively). Note , strictly, append_dw_vars() need run directly; build_dw_model() tune_dw_model() passed "hour", "weekday", "trend", "yday", "week", "month" vars, parent function use append_dw_vars() background columns exist input dataframe.

title: Meteorological Normalisation with {deweather}
text: many input parameters build_dw_model() , sensible defaults set, may interested seeing tweaking can influence well model behaves. called ‚Äútuning‚Äù, tune_dw_model() function provides interface . boosted decision tree parameters (e.g., tree_depth trees) can set range combined grid_levels create regular grid parameter combinations. Note process can take , especially many parameters tuned. One way speed invoke parallel processing mirai package - see https://tune.tidymodels.org/articles/extras/optimizations.html#parallel-processing information. example, ‚Äôll also significantly trim data speed things . output useful features. First, ‚Äôre informed best value trees 50 tree_depth 5. want interrogate , metrics object shows summary different hyperparameters tuned. Examining full set metrics, rather single best configuration, allows assess whether marginal performance gain ‚Äúbest‚Äù model justifies additional computational cost complexity. example, air quality timeseries data, likely increasing trees (number trees model) always going ‚Äòimprove‚Äô model, actual benefits may marginal certain threshold serve increase time taken fit use finalised model. can useful see data plot; plot_tdw_tuning_metrics() function allows done fairly flexibly. Note function likely use 1 3 tuned hyperparmaeters; likely messy interpretable. may useful look ‚Äòelbow‚Äô data, decrease RMSE increase RSQ goes large gradient small one. Around elbow likely good value set hyperparameter.  can also see tuned model behaved reserved testing data, using ‚Äòbest parameters‚Äô decided . set predictions included (can usefully plotted scatter chart binned surface), well set metrics evaluate.
code: tuned_results <-   aqroadside |>   # want to sample by weekday to get good spread of categorical data   append_dw_vars("weekday") |>   dplyr::slice_sample(n = 250, by = weekday) |>   # tune model   tune_dw_model(     pollutant = "no2",     tree_depth = c(1, 5),     min_n = c(5, 10),     grid_levels = 3L   ) get_tdw_best_params(tuned_results) #> $min_n #> [1] 10 #>  #> $tree_depth #> [1] 5 #>  #> $trees #> [1] 50 #>  #> $mtry #> NULL #>  #> $learn_rate #> [1] 0.1 #>  #> $loss_reduction #> [1] 0 #>  #> $sample_size #> [1] 1 #>  #> $stop_iter #> [1] 45 #>  #> $alpha #> [1] 0 #>  #> $lambda #> [1] 1 get_tdw_tuning_metrics(tuned_results) #> # A tibble: 18 √ó 6 #>    min_n tree_depth metric   mean     n std_err #>    <int>      <int> <chr>   <dbl> <int>   <dbl> #>  1     5          1 rmse   37.5      10  0.850  #>  2     5          1 rsq     0.443    10  0.0173 #>  3     5          3 rmse   31.2      10  0.720  #>  4     5          3 rsq     0.599    10  0.0200 #>  5     5          5 rmse   29.7      10  0.728  #>  6     5          5 rsq     0.628    10  0.0194 #>  7     7          1 rmse   37.5      10  0.850  #>  8     7          1 rsq     0.443    10  0.0173 #>  9     7          3 rmse   31.1      10  0.693  #> 10     7          3 rsq     0.600    10  0.0201 #> 11     7          5 rmse   29.6      10  0.645  #> 12     7          5 rsq     0.632    10  0.0199 #> 13    10          1 rmse   37.5      10  0.850  #> 14    10          1 rsq     0.443    10  0.0173 #> 15    10          3 rmse   31.1      10  0.661  #> 16    10          3 rsq     0.601    10  0.0197 #> 17    10          5 rmse   29.5      10  0.651  #> 18    10          5 rsq     0.633    10  0.0201 plot_tdw_tuning_metrics(tuned_results, x = "tree_depth", group = "min_n") get_tdw_testing_metrics(tuned_results) |>   dplyr::glimpse() #> List of 11 #>  $ n   : int 424 #>  $ fac2: num 0.965 #>  $ mb  : num -0.718 #>  $ mge : num 20.1 #>  $ nmb : num -0.00755 #>  $ nmge: num 0.212 #>  $ rmse: num 28 #>  $ r   : num 0.812 #>  $ p   : num 6.76e-101 #>  $ coe : num 0.467 #>  $ ioa : num 0.733 plot_tdw_testing_scatter(tuned_results)

title: Meteorological Normalisation with {deweather}
text: Assuming good model can developed, can now explored detail. deweather useful defaults many model parameters, can adjusted user required. Alternatively, carried model tuning, can use finalise_tdw_model() function automatically lift ‚Äòbest‚Äô parameters . functions return ‚Äúdeweather model‚Äù object. can see quick summary simply printing . can also pull specific features model using get_dw_*() functions. deweather many ‚Äògetter‚Äô functions, form consistent, useful API accessing relevant features different objects created package. One feature immediately access ‚Äúfeature importance‚Äù score. can obtained data.frame using similar approach . varies depending chosen engine, boosted trees represents ‚ÄòGain‚Äô - fractional contribution feature model based total gain feature‚Äôs splits. higher percentage means important predictive feature. Gain can automatically plotted bar chart using plot_dw_importance() function. wind direction predictive feature, day week week day least predictive feature. feature importance model. ‚Äôll notice ‚Äòcharacter‚Äô variable, day week, split multiple levels. xgboost requires numeric variables, behind scenes ‚Äòday week‚Äô variable split matrix seven variables. informative - example, can see day week weekend useful feature. Regardless, like see factor features single features, aggregate_factors argument may use. feature importance model, factors aggregated.
code: no2_model <-   build_dw_model(     data = aqroadside,     pollutant = "no2",     vars = c("trend", "ws", "wd", "hour", "weekday", "air_temp"),     engine = "xgboost"   ) no2_model_alt <- finalise_tdw_model(tuned_results, aqroadside) no2_model #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Deweather Model ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ #> A model for predicting no2 using wd (43.9%), hour (29.0%), trend (10.8%), #> weekday (8.4%), ws (5.8%), and air_temp (2.0%). #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Model Parameters ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> ‚Ä¢ tree_depth: 5 #> ‚Ä¢ trees: 50 #> ‚Ä¢ learn_rate: 0.1 #> ‚Ä¢ mtry: NULL #> ‚Ä¢ min_n: 10 #> ‚Ä¢ loss_reduction: 0 #> ‚Ä¢ sample_size: 1 #> ‚Ä¢ stop_iter: 45 get_dw_pollutant(no2_model) #> [1] "no2" get_dw_vars(no2_model) #> [1] "trend"    "ws"       "wd"       "hour"     "weekday"  "air_temp" get_dw_input_data(no2_model) #> # A tibble: 144,535 √ó 7 #>      no2     trend    ws    wd  hour weekday air_temp #>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <int> <fct>      <dbl> #>  1    78 946684800  2.1    200     0 Sat         7.4  #>  2    84 946688400  2.1    190     1 Sat         7.83 #>  3   117 946692000  1.8    215     2 Sat         7.95 #>  4    97 946695600  1.25   240     3 Sat         8.05 #>  5    74 946699200  1.55   260     4 Sat         8.6  #>  6    65 946702800  2.35   270     5 Sat         8.35 #>  7    67 946706400  1.8    260     6 Sat         8.2  #>  8    69 946710000  1      250     7 Sat         7.1  #>  9    67 946713600  0.5    240     8 Sat         6.2  #> 10    57 946720800  0.5    210    10 Sat         6.9  #> # ‚Ñπ 144,525 more rows get_dw_importance(no2_model) #> # A tibble: 12 √ó 2 #>    var        importance #>    <fct>           <dbl> #>  1 wd           0.439    #>  2 hour         0.290    #>  3 trend        0.108    #>  4 ws           0.0583   #>  5 weekdaySun   0.0479   #>  6 weekdaySat   0.0296   #>  7 air_temp     0.0196   #>  8 weekdayMon   0.00216  #>  9 weekdayThu   0.00166  #> 10 weekdayWed   0.00108  #> 11 weekdayTue   0.000806 #> 12 weekdayFri   0.000550 plot_dw_importance(no2_model) plot_dw_importance(no2_model, aggregate_factors = TRUE)

title: Meteorological Normalisation with {deweather}
text: One benefits boosted regression tree approach partial dependencies can explored. simple terms, partial dependencies show relationship pollutant interest covariates used model holding value covariates mean level. Lets plot partial dependency hour variable. ‚Äôll set n 100 speed; sample 100 random samples original data construct plot. can see no2 highest day lowest overnight, everything else kept equal.  categorical variable like weekday looks slightly different, achieves similar result. no2 lowest weekends, else equal.  variable isn‚Äôt given, variables plotted patchwork assembly order importance.
code: plot_dw_partial_1d(no2_model, "hour", n = 100) plot_dw_partial_1d(no2_model, "weekday", n = 100) plot_dw_partial_1d(no2_model, n = 100)

title: Meteorological Normalisation with {deweather}
text: Sometimes, examining partial dependences, useful consider grouped partial dependences. means, PDs calculated, split data groups calculate PDs subset data. Let‚Äôs give go now.  Note group need categorical; may provide continuous variable binned group_intervals. group "air_temp" split 3 equally sized bins.
code: plot_dw_partial_1d(no2_model, "hour", group = "weekday", n = 1000) plot_dw_partial_1d(   no2_model,   "hour",   group = "air_temp",   group_intervals = 3L,   n = 1000 )

title: Meteorological Normalisation with {deweather}
text: needed treat one continuous features factor feature. can useful plot important two-way interactions. example interaction "ws" "air_temp" considered. plot shows no2 tends high wind speed low temperature low, .e., stable atmospheric conditions. Also no2 tends high temperature high, likely due O3 available convert NO2. fact, background O3 probably useful covariate add model.  can easier see relationships using binned scale. contour = "lines" overlay continuous colour surface contour lines. contour = "fill" bin entire colour scale. number bins controlled using contour_bins argument.
code: plot_dw_partial_2d(no2_model, "ws", "air_temp", n = 200) plot_dw_partial_2d(   no2_model,   "ws",   "air_temp",   n = 200,   contour = "fill",   contour_bins = 10,   cols = "turbo" )

title: Meteorological Normalisation with {deweather}
text: plots can customised like ggplot2 object. thoroughly customised partial dependence plot.
code: library(ggplot2)  plot_dw_partial_1d(no2_model, "hour", group = "weekday") +   theme_light(14) +   theme(     title = element_text(face = "bold"),     plot.subtitle = element_text(face = "plain", size = 11),     legend.position = "none"   ) +   scale_fill_manual(     values = c(       "orange",       "cadetblue",       "lightblue4",       "lightblue3",       "lightblue2",       "lightblue1",       "orange3"     ),     aesthetics = c("fill", "color")   ) +   labs(     x = "Hour of the Day",     y = "NOx (ug/m3)",     fill = "Weekday",     color = "Weekday",     subtitle = "Weekends (orange) have lower NOx emissions than weekdays (blue)."   ) +   scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, NA)) +   scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(0, 24, 4), expand = expansion()) #> Scale for fill is already present. #> Adding another scale for fill, which will replace the existing scale. #> Scale for y is already present. #> Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale. #> Scale for x is already present. #> Adding another scale for x, which will replace the existing scale.

title: Meteorological Normalisation with {deweather}
text: indication meteorologically-averaged trend given plot_dw_partial_1d() function .  much better indication given using model predict many times random sampling meteorological conditions. sampling carried simulate_met() function. Note ‚Äôd typically want n higher value ‚Äôs used example; set 50 speed. Recall also mirai::daemons() set allow parallelism. Now possible plot resulting trend. plot_sim_trend() function convenient way . deweathered nitrogen dioxide trend. plot shows trend NO2 controlling main weather variables. plot now reveals strong diurnal weekly cycle NO2 driven variations sources NO2 (NOx) rather meteorology, .e., road traffic strong hourly daily variations throughout year. can useful simply average results provide better indication overall trend. example: time-averaged deweathered nitrogen dioxide trend. can useful compare simulated trend original input data. plot_sim_trend() can provided model used construct demet overlay plot. Also useful highlight .plot_engine argument, supports "ggplot2" static plots "plotly" interactive plots; plot_sim_trend() using plotly engine provides useful tooltips, zooming, ability toggle different traces . Note function predict_dw() also provided generalised use deweather model prediction.
code: plot_dw_partial_1d(no2_model, "trend", n = 100, intervals = 100) demet <- simulate_dw_met(   no2_model,   vars = c("ws", "wd", "air_temp"),   n = 50 ) plot_sim_trend(demet) plot_sim_trend(demet, avg.time = "month") plot_sim_trend(   demet,   dw = no2_model,   avg.time = "week",   .plot_engine = "plotly" )

title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Carslaw D, Davison J (2026). deweather: Remove influence weather air quality data. R package version 1.0.0, https://openair-project.github.io/deweather/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {deweather: Remove the influence of weather on air quality data},   author = {David Carslaw and Jack Davison},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://openair-project.github.io/deweather/}, }

title: Remove the influence of weather on air quality data
text: deweather makes straightforward test, build, evaluate models R. Test build meteorological normalisation models flexibly using tune_dw_model() build_dw_model(). Plot examine models myriad ways, including visualising partial dependencies, using functions like plot_dw_importance(), plot_dw_partial_1d() plot_dw_partial_2d(). Apply meteorological averaging using simulate_dw_met() obtain meteorologically normalised air quality timeseries. Modelling can computationally intensive therefore deweather makes use parallel processing, work Windows, Linux Mac OSX.

title: Remove the influence of weather on air quality data
text: deweather overhauled 1.0.0 update. believe update makes deweather modern flexible, appreciate users may require access prefer older version. reason, older, gbm-powered version deweather can accessed https://github.com/openair-project/deweather-archive. Note repository provided archival purposes , unlikely recieve future feature updates.

what: Conveniently append common 'deweathering' variables to an air quality time series ‚Äî append_dw_vars
title: Conveniently append common 'deweathering' variables to an air quality time series ‚Äî append_dw_vars
text: function conveniently manipulates datetime ('POSIXct') column (default named 'date') series columns useful features deweather models. Used internally build_dw_model() tune_dw_model(), can used directly users desired.

title: Conveniently append common 'deweathering' variables to an air quality time series ‚Äî append_dw_vars
code: append_dw_vars(   data,   vars = c("trend", "hour", "weekday", "weekend", "yday", "week", "month"),   abbr = TRUE,   ...,   .date = "date" )

title: Conveniently append common 'deweathering' variables to an air quality time series ‚Äî append_dw_vars
text: data input data.frame least one date(time) column. vars character vector variables interest. Possible options include: - "trend": numeric expression overall time series - "hour": hour day (0-23) - "weekday": day week (Sunday Saturday) - "weekend": whether weekend (Saturday, Sunday) weekday - "yday": day year - "week": week year - "month": month year abbr Abbreviate weekday month strings? Defaults TRUE, tends look better plots. ... currently used. .date name 'date' column use manipulation.

what: Example air quality monitoring data for openair ‚Äî aqroadside
title: Example air quality monitoring data for openair ‚Äî aqroadside
text: aqroadside represents subset long-running hourly data Marylebone Road AURN roadside monitoring station UK, bound meteorological data nearby Heathrow airport met station. Five pollutants (NOx, NO2, Ethane, Isoprene Benzene) five meteorlogical variables (wind speed, wind direction, air temperature, relative humidity, cloud height) provided.

title: Example air quality monitoring data for openair ‚Äî aqroadside
code: aqroadside

title: Example air quality monitoring data for openair ‚Äî aqroadside
text: object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 149040 rows 11 columns.

title: Example air quality monitoring data for openair ‚Äî aqroadside
Build a Deweather Model ‚Äî build_dw_model
text: function builds 'deweathering' machine learning model useful methods interrogating air quality meteorological context. uses number variables (usefully meteorological variables like wind speed wind direction temporal variables defined append_dw_vars()) fit model predicting given pollutant. models useful 'removing' effects meteorology air quality time series (e.g., simulate_dw_met()), also useful explanatory analysis (e.g., plot_dw_partial_1d()).

title: Build a Deweather Model ‚Äî build_dw_model
code: build_dw_model(   data,   pollutant,   vars = c("trend", "ws", "wd", "hour", "weekday", "air_temp"),   tree_depth = 5,   trees = 50L,   learn_rate = 0.1,   mtry = NULL,   min_n = 10L,   loss_reduction = 0,   sample_size = 1L,   stop_iter = 45L,   engine = c("xgboost", "lightgbm", "ranger"),   ...,   .date = "date" )

title: Build a Deweather Model ‚Äî build_dw_model
text: data input data.frame containing one pollutant column (defined using pollutant) collection feature columns (defined using vars). pollutant name column (likely pollutant) data predict. vars name columns data use model features - .e., predict values pollutant column. character columns coerced factors. "hour", "weekday", "trend", "yday", "week", "month" special terms passed append_dw_vars() present names(data). tree_depth Tree Depth <xgboost|lightgbm> integer maximum depth tree (.e., number splits). trees Number Trees <xgboost|lightgbm|ranger> integer number trees contained ensemble. learn_rate Learning Rate <xgboost|lightgbm> number rate boosting algorithm adapts iteration--iteration. sometimes referred shrinkage parameter. mtry Number Randomly Selected Predictors <xgboost|lightgbm|ranger> number number (proportion) predictors randomly sampled split creating tree models. min_n Minimal Node Size <xgboost|lightgbm|ranger> integer minimum number data points node required node split . loss_reduction Minimum Loss Reduction <xgboost|lightgbm> number reduction loss function required split . sample_size Proportion Observations Sampled <xgboost> number number (proportion) data exposed fitting routine. stop_iter Number Iterations Stopping <xgboost> number iterations without improvement stopping. engine single character string specifying computational engine use fitting. Can "xgboost", "lightgbm" (boosted trees) "ranger" (random forest). See documentation information. ... Used pass additional engine-specific parameters model. parameters listed can tuned using tune_dw_model(). parameters must fixed. alpha: <xgboost> L1 regularization term weights. lambda: <xgboost> L2 regularization term weights. num_leaves: <lightgbm> max number leaves one tree. regularization.factor: <ranger> Regularization factor (gain penalization). regularization.usedepth: <ranger> Consider depth regularization? (TRUE/FALSE). splitrule: <ranger> Splitting rule. One dials::ranger_reg_rules. alpha: <ranger> Significance threshold allow splitting (splitrule = "maxstat"). minprop: <ranger> Lower quantile covariate distribution considered splitting (splitrule = "maxstat"). num.random.splits: <ranger> Number random splits consider candidate splitting variable (splitrule = "extratrees"). .date name 'date' column defines air quality timeseries. Passed append_dw_vars() needed. Also used extract time zone data later restoration trend used variable.

title: Build a Deweather Model ‚Äî build_dw_model
text: 'Deweather' object analysis

title: Build a Deweather Model ‚Äî build_dw_model
text: two modelling approaches available build_dw_model(): Boosted Trees (xgboost, lightgbm) Random Forest (ranger) approaches take different parameters.

title: Build a Deweather Model ‚Äî build_dw_model
text: Two engines available boosted tree models: "xgboost" "lightgbm" following universal parameters apply tunable: tree_depth: Tree Depth trees: # Trees learn_rate: Learning Rate mtry: # Randomly Selected Predictors min_n: Minimal Node Size loss_reduction: Minimum Loss Reduction sample_size: Proportion Observations Sampled (xgboost ) stop_iter: # Iterations Stopping (xgboost ) following xgboost-specific parameters tunable: alpha: L1 regularization term weights. Increasing value make model conservative lambda: L2 regularization term weights. Increasing value make model conservative following lightgbm-specific parameters tunable: num_leaves: max number leaves one tree

title: Build a Deweather Model ‚Äî build_dw_model
text: One engine available random forest models: "ranger" following universal parameters apply tunable: mtry: # Randomly Selected Predictors trees: # Trees min_n: Minimal Node Size following ranger-specific parameters tunable: regularization.factor: Regularization factor (gain penalization) regularization.usedepth: Consider depth regularization? (TRUE/FALSE) splitrule: Splitting rule. One dials::ranger_reg_rules alpha: Significance threshold allow splitting (splitrule = "maxstat") minprop: Lower quantile covariate distribution considered splitting (splitrule = "maxstat") num.random.splits: Number random splits consider candidate splitting variable (splitrule = "extratrees")

what: deweather: Remove the influence of weather on air quality data ‚Äî deweather-package
title: deweather: Remove the influence of weather on air quality data ‚Äî deweather-package
text: Model account (remove) effect meteorology atmospheric composition data. technique uses boosted regression trees via tidymodels framework.

title: deweather: Remove the influence of weather on air quality data ‚Äî deweather-package
text: Maintainer: David Carslaw david.carslaw@york.ac.uk (ORCID) Authors: Jack Davison jack.davison@ricardo.com (ORCID)

what: Use the 'best parameters' determined by tune_dw_model() to build a Deweather Model ‚Äî finalise_tdw_model
title: Use the 'best parameters' determined by tune_dw_model() to build a Deweather Model ‚Äî finalise_tdw_model
text: function takes output tune_dw_model() uses best_params defined within. convenient wrapper around build_dw_model() already run tune_dw_model() broadly happy parameters chosen. said, params argument can used override specific hyperparameters.

title: Use the 'best parameters' determined by tune_dw_model() to build a Deweather Model ‚Äî finalise_tdw_model
code: finalise_tdw_model(tdw, data, params = list(), ..., .date = "date")

title: Use the 'best parameters' determined by tune_dw_model() to build a Deweather Model ‚Äî finalise_tdw_model
text: tdw deweather tuning object created tune_dw_model(). data input data.frame containing one pollutant column (defined using pollutant) collection feature columns (defined using vars). must provided addition tdw expected users provided tune_dw_model() sampled dataset. params named list. parameters used override best_params defined within tdw. example, 'best' parameter trees 50, params = list(trees = 100) set 100 instead. also includes engine-specific parameters (e.g., lambda xgboost engine). ... currently used. add engine-specific models, add tune_dw_model() picked automatically, use build_dw_model() directly. .date name 'date' column defines air quality timeseries. Passed append_dw_vars() needed. Also used extract time zone data later restoration trend used variable.

title: Use the 'best parameters' determined by tune_dw_model() to build a Deweather Model ‚Äî finalise_tdw_model
text: Jack Davison

what: Getters for various deweather model features ‚Äî get_dw_pollutant
title: Getters for various deweather model features ‚Äî get_dw_pollutant
text: deweather provides multiple 'getter' functions extracting relevant model features deweather model /tuning objects. useful convenience, particularly conjunction R's pipe operator (|>).

title: Getters for various deweather model features ‚Äî get_dw_pollutant
code: get_dw_pollutant(dw)  get_dw_vars(dw)  get_dw_engine(dw)  get_dw_params(dw, param = NULL)  get_dw_input_data(dw)  get_dw_model(dw)  get_dw_importance(dw, aggregate_factors = FALSE, sort = TRUE)

title: Getters for various deweather model features ‚Äî get_dw_pollutant
text: dw deweather model created build_dw_model(). param get_dw_params() get_tdw_best_params(). default (NULL) returns list model parameters. param return one specific parameter character vector. aggregate_factors Defaults FALSE. TRUE, importance factor inputs (e.g., Weekday) summed single variable. applies certain engines (e.g., "xgboost") report factor importance disaggregate features. sort TRUE, default, features sorted importance. FALSE, sorted alphabetically. plot_dw_importance() change ordering y-axis, whereas get_dw_importance() change whether var returned factor character data type.

title: Getters for various deweather model features ‚Äî get_dw_pollutant
text: Typically character vector, except: get_dw_params(): list, unless param set. get_dw_importance(): data.frame get_dw_model(): parsnip::model_fit object

what: Visualise deweather model feature importance ‚Äî plot_dw_importance
title: Visualise deweather model feature importance ‚Äî plot_dw_importance
text: Visualise feature importance (% Gain boosted tree models, permutation importance random forest models) variable deweather model bar chart, customisation.

title: Visualise deweather model feature importance ‚Äî plot_dw_importance
code: plot_dw_importance(   dw,   aggregate_factors = FALSE,   sort = TRUE,   cols = "tol",   ...,   .plot = TRUE,   .plot_engine = NULL )

title: Visualise deweather model feature importance ‚Äî plot_dw_importance
text: dw deweather model created build_dw_model(). aggregate_factors Defaults FALSE. TRUE, importance factor inputs (e.g., Weekday) summed single variable. applies certain engines (e.g., "xgboost") report factor importance disaggregate features. sort TRUE, default, features sorted importance. FALSE, sorted alphabetically. plot_dw_importance() change ordering y-axis, whereas get_dw_importance() change whether var returned factor character data type. cols Colours use plotting. See openair::openColours(). ... currently used. .plot FALSE, return data.frame plot data instead plot. .plot_engine plotting engine use. One "ggplot2", returns static plot, "plotly", returns dynamic HTML plot.

title: Visualise deweather model feature importance ‚Äî plot_dw_importance
text: ggplot2 figure

title: Visualise deweather model feature importance ‚Äî plot_dw_importance
text: deweather offers different plotting engines different purposes. moment, two plotting engines supported: "ggplot2", static plotting. engine produces plots can easily saved .png, .svg, 'static' file format. save ggplot2 plot, recommended use ggplot2::ggsave() function. "plotly", dynamic plotting. engine produces HTML plots suitable embedding quarto rmarkdown documents, use shiny applications. can saved using functions like htmlwidgets::saveWidget(). plotting engine defined using .plot_engine argument plot_* function deweather.   .plot_engine set, engine defaults "ggplot2". However, option can overridden using deweather.plot_engine global option.   Note arguments function may apply plotting engines. example, hexagonal binning plot_tdw_testing_scatter() supported ggplot2 plotly time writing.
code: # use default plot_dw_importance(dw)  # set to ggplot2 (static) plot_dw_importance(dw, .plot_engine = "ggplot2")  # set to plotly (HTML) plot_dw_importance(dw, .plot_engine = "plotly") # set once per session options("deweather.plot_engine" = "plotly")  # now defaults to "plotly" over "ggplot2" plot_dw_importance(dw)

what: Create partial dependence plots for deweather models ‚Äî plot_dw_partial_1d
title: Create partial dependence plots for deweather models ‚Äî plot_dw_partial_1d
text: Generates partial dependence plots visualize relationship predictor variables model predictions. plots show predicted pollutant concentration changes function one variable averaging effects variables.

title: Create partial dependence plots for deweather models ‚Äî plot_dw_partial_1d
code: plot_dw_partial_1d(   dw,   vars = NULL,   intervals = 40L,   group = NULL,   group_intervals = 3L,   show_conf_int = TRUE,   show_rug = TRUE,   n = NULL,   prop = 0.01,   cols = "tol",   ylim = NULL,   radial_wd = TRUE,   ncol = NULL,   nrow = NULL,   ...,   .plot = TRUE,   .plot_engine = NULL,   .progress = rlang::is_interactive() )

title: Create partial dependence plots for deweather models ‚Äî plot_dw_partial_1d
text: dw deweather model created build_dw_model(). vars Character. name variable(s) plot. Must one variables used model. NULL, variables plotted order importance. intervals number points partial dependence profile. group Optional grouping variable show separate profiles different levels another predictor. Must one variables used model. Default NULL (grouping). group_intervals number bins group variable numeric. show_conf_int bootstrapped 95% confidence interval shown? plot_dw_partial_1d() shown using transparent ribbons (numeric variables) rectangles (categorical variables). show_rug 'rug' (ticks along x-axis) shown identifies exact intervals parameter? n number observations use calculating partial dependence profile. NULL (default), uses prop determine sample size. prop proportion input data use calculating partial dependence profile, 0 1. Default 0.01 (1% input data). Ignored n specified. cols Colours use plotting. See openair::openColours(). ylim limits y-axis. default, NULL, allows partial dependence panel y-axis scale. radial_wd "wd" (wind direction) variable plotted radial axis? can enhance interpretability, makes inconsistent variables plotted cartesian coordinates. Defaults TRUE. ncol, nrow one vars defined, ncol nrow define dimensions grid create. Setting NULL creates roughly square grid. ... currently used. .plot FALSE, return data.frame plot data instead plot. .plot_engine plotting engine use. One "ggplot2", returns static plot, "plotly", returns dynamic HTML plot. .progress Show progress bar? Defaults TRUE interactive sessions.

title: Create partial dependence plots for deweather models ‚Äî plot_dw_partial_1d
text: ggplot2 object showing partial dependence plot. multiple vars specified, patchwork assembly plots returned. plot = FALSE, named list plot data returned instead.

title: Create partial dependence plots for deweather models ‚Äî plot_dw_partial_1d
text: function supports parallel processing using {mirai} package. likely find performance function increases "daemons" set. greatest benefits seen spawn many daemons cores machine, although one fewer available cores often good rule thumb.
code: # set workers - once per session mirai::daemons(4)  # run your function as normal tune_dw_model(aqroadside, "no2", tree_depth = c(5, 10))

title: Create partial dependence plots for deweather models ‚Äî plot_dw_partial_1d
text: deweather offers different plotting engines different purposes. moment, two plotting engines supported: "ggplot2", static plotting. engine produces plots can easily saved .png, .svg, 'static' file format. save ggplot2 plot, recommended use ggplot2::ggsave() function. "plotly", dynamic plotting. engine produces HTML plots suitable embedding quarto rmarkdown documents, use shiny applications. can saved using functions like htmlwidgets::saveWidget(). plotting engine defined using .plot_engine argument plot_* function deweather.   .plot_engine set, engine defaults "ggplot2". However, option can overridden using deweather.plot_engine global option.   Note arguments function may apply plotting engines. example, hexagonal binning plot_tdw_testing_scatter() supported ggplot2 plotly time writing.

what: Create a 2-way partial dependence plot for deweather models ‚Äî plot_dw_partial_2d
title: Create a 2-way partial dependence plot for deweather models ‚Äî plot_dw_partial_2d
text: Generates 2-way partial dependence plot visualize relationship two predictor variables model predictions. plots show predicted pollutant concentration changes function two variables averaging effects variables.

title: Create a 2-way partial dependence plot for deweather models ‚Äî plot_dw_partial_2d
code: plot_dw_partial_2d(   dw,   var_x = NULL,   var_y = NULL,   intervals = 40L,   contour = c("none", "lines", "fill"),   contour_bins = 8,   exclude_distance = 0.05,   show_conf_int = FALSE,   n = NULL,   prop = 0.01,   cols = "viridis",   radial_wd = FALSE,   ...,   .plot = TRUE,   .plot_engine = NULL,   .progress = rlang::is_interactive() )

title: Create a 2-way partial dependence plot for deweather models ‚Äî plot_dw_partial_2d
text: dw deweather model created build_dw_model(). var_x, var_y name two variables plot. Must one variables used model. missing, top two individually important numeric variables selected automatically. intervals number points partial dependence profile. contour Show contour lines plot? Can one "none" (default, contour lines), "lines" (draws lines) "fill" (draws filled contours using binned colour scale). contour_bins many bins drawn contour != "none"? exclude_distance 2-way partial dependence plot uses mgcv::exclude..far() ensure plotted surface within range original input data. exclude_distance defines far away original data far plot. range 0 1, higher values permissive; 1 retain data. show_conf_int bootstrapped 95% confidence interval shown? plot_dw_partial_2d() creates separate facets lower higher confidence intervals. may easiest see difference using contour = "fill". n number observations use calculating partial dependence profile. NULL (default), uses prop determine sample size. prop proportion input data use calculating partial dependence profile, 0 1. Default 0.01 (1% input data). Ignored n specified. cols Colours use plotting. See openair::openColours(). radial_wd "wd" (wind direction) variable plotted radial axis? can enhance interpretability, makes inconsistent variables plotted cartesian coordinates. Defaults FALSE. ... currently used. .plot FALSE, return data.frame plot data instead plot. .plot_engine plotting engine use. One "ggplot2", returns static plot, "plotly", returns dynamic HTML plot. .progress Show progress bar? Defaults TRUE interactive sessions.

title: Create a 2-way partial dependence plot for deweather models ‚Äî plot_dw_partial_2d
text: ggplot2 object showing partial dependence plot. plot = FALSE, named list plot data returned instead.

title: Create a 2-way partial dependence plot for deweather models ‚Äî plot_dw_partial_2d
text: function supports parallel processing using {mirai} package. likely find performance function increases "daemons" set. greatest benefits seen spawn many daemons cores machine, although one fewer available cores often good rule thumb.

title: Create a 2-way partial dependence plot for deweather models ‚Äî plot_dw_partial_2d
text: deweather offers different plotting engines different purposes. moment, two plotting engines supported: "ggplot2", static plotting. engine produces plots can easily saved .png, .svg, 'static' file format. save ggplot2 plot, recommended use ggplot2::ggsave() function. "plotly", dynamic plotting. engine produces HTML plots suitable embedding quarto rmarkdown documents, use shiny applications. can saved using functions like htmlwidgets::saveWidget(). plotting engine defined using .plot_engine argument plot_* function deweather.   .plot_engine set, engine defaults "ggplot2". Lines appear beneath "scatter" method either "bin" methods. show_params Show annotation model parameters top-left corner scatter plot? cols Colours use plotting. what: Function to run random meteorological simulations on a deweather model ‚Äî simulate_dw_met
title: Function to run random meteorological simulations on a deweather model ‚Äî simulate_dw_met
text: function performs random simulations help isolate effect emissions changes meteorological variability air quality data. works repeatedly shuffling meteorological variables (like wind air temperature) keeping temporal patterns intact, predicting pollutant concentrations using trained deweather model.

title: Function to run random meteorological simulations on a deweather model ‚Äî simulate_dw_met
code: simulate_dw_met(   dw,   newdata = deweather::get_dw_input_data(dw),   vars = c("ws", "wd", "air_temp"),   resampling = c("constrained", "all"),   window_day = 30,   window_hour = 2,   n = 200,   aggregate = TRUE,   ...,   .progress = rlang::is_interactive() )

title: Function to run random meteorological simulations on a deweather model ‚Äî simulate_dw_met
text: dw deweather model created build_dw_model(). newdata Data set apply model. missing data used build model first place used. vars variables randomly varied. Note typically meteorological variables (e.g., "ws", "wd", "air_temp") temporal emission proxies (e.g., "hour", "weekday", "week"). resampling resampling strategy. One : "constrained" (default), meaning days year close target date sampled. option used conjunction window_day window_hour. example, window_day 30 sample +/-30 days date. "", meaning dates shuffled. argument using constrained resampling resamples conditions similar time year / hour day minimise resampling implausible conditions e.g. warm temperatures winter. window_day, window_hour day year (window_day) hour day (window_hour) windows sample within resampling = "constrained". example, window_day = 30 samples within +/-30 days given date. n number simulations use. aggregate default, simulations aggregated single time series. aggregate = FALSE, simulations returned single data frame .id column distinguishing . ... currently used. .progress Show progress bar? Defaults TRUE interactive sessions.

title: Function to run random meteorological simulations on a deweather model ‚Äî simulate_dw_met
text: tibble

title: Function to run random meteorological simulations on a deweather model ‚Äî simulate_dw_met
text: function supports parallel processing using {mirai} package. likely find performance function increases "daemons" set. greatest benefits seen spawn many daemons cores machine, although one fewer available cores often good rule thumb.
code: # set workers - once per session mirai::daemons(4)  # run your function as normal tune_dw_model(aqroadside, "no2", tree_depth = c(5, 10))

title: Function to run random meteorological simulations on a deweather model ‚Äî simulate_dw_met
text: David Carslaw

title: Tune a deweather model ‚Äî tune_dw_model
text: function performs hyperparameter tuning gradient boosting model used deweathering air pollution data. uses cross-validation find optimal hyperparameters returns best performing model along performance metrics visualizations. Parallel processing (e.g., mirai package) recommended speed tuning - see https://tune.tidymodels.org/articles/extras/optimizations.html#parallel-processing.

title: Tune a deweather model ‚Äî tune_dw_model
code: tune_dw_model(   data,   pollutant,   vars = c("trend", "ws", "wd", "hour", "weekday", "air_temp"),   tree_depth = 5,   trees = 50L,   learn_rate = 0.1,   mtry = NULL,   min_n = 10L,   loss_reduction = 0,   sample_size = 1L,   stop_iter = 45L,   engine = c("xgboost", "lightgbm", "ranger"),   split_prop = 3/4,   grid_levels = 5,   v_partitions = 10,   ...,   .progress = TRUE,   .date = "date" )

title: Tune a deweather model ‚Äî tune_dw_model
text: data input data.frame containing one pollutant column (defined using pollutant) collection feature columns (defined using vars). pollutant name column (likely pollutant) data predict. vars name columns data use model features - .e., predict values pollutant column. character columns coerced factors. "hour", "weekday", "trend", "yday", "week", "month" special terms passed append_dw_vars() present names(data). tree_depth, trees, learn_rate, mtry, min_n, loss_reduction, sample_size, stop_iter length 1, parameters fixed. length 2, parameter tuned within range defined first last value. example, tree_depth = c(1, 5) grid_levels = 3, tree depths 1, 3, 5 tested. See build_dw_model() specific parameter definitions. engine single character string specifying computational engine use fitting. Can "xgboost", "lightgbm" (boosted trees) "ranger" (random forest). See documentation information. split_prop proportion data retained modeling/analysis. Passed prop argument rsample::initial_split(). grid_levels integer number values parameter use make regular grid. Passed levels argument dials::grid_regular(). v_partitions number partitions data set use v-fold cross-validation. Passed v argument rsample::vfold_cv(). ... Used pass additional engine-specific parameters model. parameters listed can tuned using tune_dw_model(). parameters must fixed. alpha: <xgboost> L1 regularization term weights. lambda: <xgboost> L2 regularization term weights. num_leaves: <lightgbm> max number leaves one tree. regularization.factor: <ranger> Regularization factor (gain penalization). regularization.usedepth: <ranger> Consider depth regularization? (TRUE/FALSE). splitrule: <ranger> Splitting rule. One dials::ranger_reg_rules. alpha: <ranger> Significance threshold allow splitting (splitrule = "maxstat"). minprop: <ranger> Lower quantile covariate distribution considered splitting (splitrule = "maxstat"). num.random.splits: <ranger> Number random splits consider candidate splitting variable (splitrule = "extratrees"). .progress Log progress console? Passed verbose argument tune::control_grid(). Note logging occur parallel processing used. .date name 'date' column defines air quality timeseries. Passed append_dw_vars() needed. Also used extract time zone data later restoration trend used variable.

title: Tune a deweather model ‚Äî tune_dw_model
text: function performs following steps: Removes rows missing values pollutant predictor variables Splits data training testing sets Creates tuning grid parameters specified ranges Performs grid search cross-validation find optimal hyperparameters Fits final model using best hyperparameters Generates predictions performance metrics least one hyperparameter must specified range (vector length 2) tuning occur. Single values treated fixed parameters.

title: Tune a deweather model ‚Äî tune_dw_model
text: function supports parallel processing using {mirai} package. likely find performance function increases "daemons" set. greatest benefits seen spawn many daemons cores machine, although one fewer available cores often good rule thumb.
code: # set workers - once per session mirai::daemons(4)  # run your function as normal tune_dw_model(aqroadside, "no2", tree_depth = c(5, 10))

title: Tune a deweather model ‚Äî tune_dw_model
text: two modelling approaches available build_dw_model(): Boosted Trees (xgboost, lightgbm) Random Forest (ranger) approaches take different parameters.

title: Tune a deweather model ‚Äî tune_dw_model
text: Two engines available boosted tree models: "xgboost" "lightgbm" following universal parameters apply tunable: tree_depth: Tree Depth trees: # Trees learn_rate: Learning Rate mtry: # Randomly Selected Predictors min_n: Minimal Node Size loss_reduction: Minimum Loss Reduction sample_size: Proportion Observations Sampled (xgboost ) stop_iter: # Iterations Stopping (xgboost ) following xgboost-specific parameters tunable: alpha: L1 regularization term weights. Increasing value make model conservative lambda: L2 regularization term weights. Increasing value make model conservative following lightgbm-specific parameters tunable: num_leaves: max number leaves one tree

title: Tune a deweather model ‚Äî tune_dw_model
text: One engine available random forest models: "ranger" following universal parameters apply tunable: mtry: # Randomly Selected Predictors trees: # Trees min_n: Minimal Node Size following ranger-specific parameters tunable: regularization.factor: Regularization factor (gain penalization) regularization.usedepth: Consider depth regularization? (TRUE/FALSE) splitrule: Splitting rule. One dials::ranger_reg_rules alpha: Significance threshold allow splitting (splitrule = "maxstat") minprop: Lower quantile covariate distribution considered splitting (splitrule = "maxstat") num.random.splits: Number random splits consider candidate splitting variable (splitrule = "extratrees")

title: Tune a deweather model ‚Äî tune_dw_model
text: Jack Davison

title: deweather 1.0.0
text: Version 1.0.0 deweather complete re-write deweather package. new version: Uses tidymodels framework, allowing flexibility model engines. deweather 1.0.0 launches xgboost, lightgbm ranger engines available. Provides much flexible partial dependency calculations, including grouped PDs. Uses flexible mirai package support parallelisation. Uses consistent function object naming scheme easier applications. main reason prompting change retirement gbm R package, slow development gbm3. xgboost lightgbm modern, fast, popular, highly capable implementations gradient boosted machine learning. original version deweather (including NEWS.md) archived https://github.com/openair-project/deweather-archive users still interested old API.

title: deweather 1.0.0
text: Model building functions: build_dw_model() fits deweather model, used rest package. tune_dw_model() allows different modelling parameters tweaked experimented . append_dw_vars() attaches variety modelling variables, used automatically within two functions. get_dw_pollutant() family allows specific features deweather models extracted consistently. Visualisation functions: plot_dw_importance() provides quick plot variable importance deweather model. plot_dw_partial_1d() calculates visualises partial dependencies subset model variables. plot_dw_partial_2d() calculates visualises two-dimensional partial dependencies. Modelling functions: predict_dw() allows use deweather model predictions. simulate_dw_met() simulate timeseries selected meteorological variables averaged, effectively helping ‚Äòremove‚Äô influence met variables.
